WRITING.TEXT: Yes, it #8217;s a funeral procession from Delaware going to NY for a deceased FDNY fireman.

I #8217;m in the same situation right now, I was told by the other parties insurance company he had 30 days to respond or they will throw out the claim and I will have to sue. Not happy that the driver who hit me is ignoring the insurance company after telling me that his insurance would take care of everything!

Of course not, I totally understand the concept, but with the police report involved, and with him already confirming what happened on the report I figured that #8217;d be enough for the company to go through with the claim. But yeah, unfortunately that is insurance standards.

Most departments to my knowledge shouldn #8217;t have an issue with that. By time you go through the entire hiring process, you will be 21 when you enter the academy. Contact the departments you want to apply to and just double check that it #8217;s okay. Goodluck!
This will all depend on your location. Different states will have slightly different steps on how to actually get the process started.
If I were you, commute would be the least of my worries. Take the offer while you have it, an hour commute isn #8217;t bad, especially if this is the only department that has offered you employment.
If she #8217;s not supportive of what you want to do, maybe she ain #8217;t the one #129335; #127995; #8205; #9794; #65039;
Most likely to include you in the report.
annnnnd mookie just stoke their HR
